document.masterDocTitle: A review of the Barsine hypoprepioides (Walker, 1862) species-group, with descriptions of fifteen new species and a new subspecies (Lepidoptera, Erebidae, Arctiinae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A review of the Barsine hypoprepioides (Walker, 1862) species-group, with descriptions of fifteen new species and a new subspecies (Lepidoptera, Erebidae, Arctiinae)

subSubSection.paragraph:
Miltochrista kuatunensis Daniel, 1951
, Bonner zoologische Beiträge , 2 (3–4): 315, Pl. 1, fig. 19 ( Type locality: [ China Fujian ] “Fukien: Kuatun, 2300 m ”).

Type material examined.
Holotype
( Fig. 80 ): ♂ , [ China , Fujian ] Kuatun ,
2300 m
( Fukien ), 27,40 N Lat / 117,40 E Long ,
13.VIII.1938
, H. Höne [leg.]
/
Holotypus
Miltochrista kuatuni Daniel.
, slide AV1858 ♂ Volynkin (Coll. ZFMK )
.
Paratype
( Fig. 186 ): ♂ , [ China , Fujian ] Kuatun , prov. Fukien ,
4.VIII.
[19]38, [leg.] Höne / Re-Paratype Miltochr.
kuatunensis Dan.
, slide AV1863 ♂ Volynkin (Coll. ZFMK )
.

VIETNAM
: 2 ♀ , [ N Vietnam ] Tonkin , Hanoi , leg. Franz Daniel ( Coll. MWM/ ZSM )
;
1 ♂ , [N] Vietnam , Tam Dao ,
25.IX.
[19]78, A. Helia leg., slide AV4627
♂ Volynkin ( Coll. CKC )
.

Diagnosis . Forewing length is 10.5–11 mm in males and 12–12.5 mm in females.
Barsine kuatunensis
is externally very similar to the allopatric
B. takamukui
and can be differed from it by the genitalia structure only. The male genitalia of
B. kuatunensis
differ from those of
B. takamukui
by the valva being broader distally, the basally broader medial costal process, the slightly larger ventral diverticulum, and the presence of a medial row of small cornuti in vesica. The female genitalia of
B. kuatunensis
differ from those of
B. takamukui
by their slightly larger corpus bursae having signum (that is absent in
B. takamukui
), and smaller appendix bursae.
Distribution . South China ( Sichuan , Fujian , Guangdong ) ( Fang 2000 ; Kishida 2011 ) and North Vietnam .
